intro: Schoenoplectus acutus f. congestus, commonly known as the dense bulrush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence and narrow, grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow waters. It has fibrous roots that help stabilize soil and improve water filtration. The species is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in moist conditions.
